intro: Cryptandra minutifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered cryptandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is a shrub that grows to a height of about 0.5 to 1 meter, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cryptandra minutifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role in its native habitat.
